parse.title: The Precincts of Felicity: The Augustinian City of the Oxford Christians

{{book | title=The Precincts of Felicity:
The Augustinian City of the Oxford Christians | image = The precincts felicity augustinian christians.jpg | author=Charles Wickleffe Moorman | foreword= | editor= | contributors= | illustrator= | publisher=University of Florida Press | publisherUK= | publisherUS= | date=[[July]] [[1966]] | dateUK= | dateUS= | format=hardcover | pages=143 | isbn= | noisbn= | issn= | series= | precededby= | followedby= }} '''''The Precincts of Felicity: The Augustinian City of the Oxford Christians''''' is a book which compares the works of the [[Inklings]] from a theological perspective. ==From the publisher== {{blockquote|An Analysis of the Oxford Christians, Charles Williams, C.S. Lewis, J.R.R. Tolkien, and by extension, T.S. Eliot, and Dorothy Sayers- as they relate to the image of St. Augustine's City of God. An interesting analysis of a fertile literary group}} {{title|italics}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Precincts of Felicity: The Augustinian City of the Oxford Christians}} [[Category:Publications by title]] [[Category:Religious books]] [[Category:Scholarly books]]
